puku.viewsWelcome.signIn.message:
Sign in to enable features powered by Puku Editor.

[Sign in](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)

puku.viewsWelcome.individual.expired:
Your Copilot subscription has expired.

[Review Copilot Settings](https://github.com/settings/copilot?editor=vscode)
puku.viewsWelcome.enterprise: Contact your GitHub organization administrator to enable Copilot.

puku.viewsWelcome.offline.message:
You are currently offline. Please connect to the internet to use Puku Editor.

[Retry Connection](command:puku.refreshToken)

puku.viewsWelcome.contactSupport.message:
There seems to be a problem with your account. Please contact GitHub support.

[Contact Support](https://support.github.com/?editor=vscode)

puku.viewsWelcome.chatDisabled.message:
Puku Editor Chat is currently disabled for your account by an organization administrator. Contact an organization administrator to enable chat.

[Learn More](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/managing-copilot/managing-github-copilot-in-your-organization/managing-github-copilot-features-in-your-organization/managing-policies-for-copilot-in-your-organization)

puku.viewsWelcome.switchToReleaseChannel.message:
The Pre-Release version of the Puku Editor Chat extension is not currently supported in the stable version of VS Code. Please switch to the release version for Puku Editor Chat or try VS Code Insiders.

[Switch to Release Version and Reload](command:runCommands?%7B%22commands%22%3A%5B%7B%22command%22%3A%22workbench.extensions.action.switchToRelease%22%2C%22args%22%3A%5B%22GitHub.copilot-chat%22%5D%7D%2C%22workbench.action.reloadWindow%22%5D%7D)

[Switch to VS Code Insiders](https://aka.ms/vscode-insiders)

puku.viewsWelcome.debug.message: Debug using a [terminal command](command:puku.chat.startCopilotDebugCommand) or in an [interactive chat](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22query%22%3A%22%40vscode%20%2FstartDebugging%20%22%2C%22isPartialQuery%22%3Atrue%7D).

puku.command.triggerPermissiveSignIn: Login to GitHub with Full Permissions
puku.config.enableCodeActions: Controls if Copilot commands are shown as Code Actions when available
puku.config.renameSuggestions.triggerAut: Controls whether Copilot generates suggestions for renaming
puku.config.localeOverride: Specify a locale that Copilot should respond in, e.g. `en` or `fr`. By default, Copilot will respond using VS Code's configured display language locale.
puku.config.edits.enabled: Whether to enable the Copilot Edits feature.
puku.config.codesearch.enabled: Whether to enable agentic codesearch when using `#codebase`.
puku.nextEditSuggestions.enabled:
Whether to enable next edit suggestions (NES).

NES can propose a next edit based on your recent changes. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/vscode-nes) about next edit suggestions.
puku.nextEditSuggestions.fixes: Whether to offer fixes for diagnostics via next edit suggestions (NES).
puku.nextEditSuggestions.allowWhitespace: Whether to allow whitespace-only changes be proposed by next edit suggestions (NES).
puku.chat.copilotDebugCommand.enabled: Whether the `copilot-debug` command is enabled in the terminal.
puku.config.terminalChatLocation: Controls where chat queries from the terminal should be opened.
puku.config.scopeSelection: Whether to prompt the user to select a specific symbol scope if the user uses `/explain` and the active editor has no selection.
puku.config.debugTerminalCommands: Whether to quick fix hints in the debug terminal and the `copilot-debug` command.
puku.config.debugTerminalCommandPatterns: A list of commands for which the "Debug Command" quick fix action should be shown in the debug terminal.
puku.config.edits.suggestRelatedFilesFro: Whether to suggest related files from git history for the Copilot Edits working set.
puku.chat.edits.suggestRelatedFilesForTe: Whether to suggest source files from test files for the Copilot Edits working set.
puku.config.suggestRelatedFilesFromGitHi: Use embeddings to suggest related files from git history.
puku.config.codeGeneration.instructions:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
puku.config.codeGeneration.useInstructio:
Controls whether code instructions from `.github/copilot-instructions.md` are added to Copilot requests.

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/github-copilot-custom-instructions) about customizing Copilot.
puku.config.codeGeneration.instruction.t: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
puku.config.codeGeneration.instruction.f: A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
puku.config.testGeneration.instructions:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
puku.config.reviewSelection.enabled: Enables code review on current selection.
puku.config.reviewSelection.instructions:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's effectiveness.
A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
puku.config.commitMessageGeneration.inst:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use conventional commit message format." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
puku.config.pullRequestDescriptionGenera:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Always include a list of key changes." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
puku.config.generateTests.codeLens: Show 'Generate tests' code lens for symbols that are not covered by current test coverage information.
puku.config.notebook.followCellExecution: Controls whether the currently executing cell is revealed into the viewport upon execution from Copilot.
puku.config.notebook.enhancedNextEditSug: Controls whether to use an enhanced approach for generating next edit suggestions in notebook cells.
puku.config.imageUpload.enabled: Enables the use of image upload URLs in chat requests instead of raw base64 strings.
puku.config.setupTests.enabled: Enables the `/setupTests` intent and prompting in `/tests` generation.
puku.config.byok.ollamaEndpoint: The endpoint to use for the Ollama when accessed via bring your own key. Defaults to localhost.
puku.config.virtualTools.threshold:
This setting defines the tool count over which virtual tools should be used. Virtual tools group similar sets of tools together and they allow the model to activate them on-demand. Certain tool groups will optimistically be pre-activated. We are actively developing this feature and you experience degraded tool calling once the threshold is hit.

May be set to `0` to disable virtual tools.
puku.config.alternateGptPrompt.enabled: Enables an experimental alternate prompt for GPT models instead of the default prompt.
puku.config.gpt5CodexAlternatePrompt: Specifies an experimental alternate prompt to use for the GPT-5-Codex model.

puku.submenu.reviewComment.discard.label: Discard
puku.config.useProjectTemplates: Use relevant GitHub projects as starter projects when using `/new`
puku.command.generateSTest: Generate STest From Last Chat Request
puku.walkthrough.title: Puku Editor
puku.walkthrough.description: Your AI pair programmer to write code faster and smarter
puku.command.refreshClaudeCodeSessions: Refresh Claude Code CLI Agent Sessions
puku.walkthrough.signIn.title: Sign in with GitHub
puku.walkthrough.signIn.description:
To get started with Copilot, sign in with your GitHub account.
Make sure you're using the correct GitHub account. You can also sign in later using the account menu.

[Sign In](command:puku.signIn)
puku.walkthrough.signIn.media.altText: Sign in to GitHub via this walkthrough or VS Code's account menu
puku.walkthrough.setup.signIn.title: Sign in to use Copilot for free
puku.walkthrough.setup.signIn.descriptio:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)
puku.walkthrough.setup.signUp.title: Get started with Copilot for free
puku.walkthrough.setup.signUp.descriptio:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)
puku.walkthrough.setup.noAction.descript:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.
puku.walkthrough.firstSuggest.title: AI-suggested inline suggestions
puku.walkthrough.firstSuggest.descriptio: As you type in the editor, Copilot suggests code to help you complete what you started.
puku.walkthrough.firstSuggest.media.altT: The video shows different Copilot inline suggestions, where Copilot suggests code to help the user complete their code
puku.walkthrough.panelChat.title: Chat about your code
puku.walkthrough.panelChat.description:
Ask Copilot programming questions or get help with your code using **@workspace**.
 Type **@** to see all available chat participants that you can chat with directly, each with their own expertise.
[Chat with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22ask%22%7D)
puku.walkthrough.panelChat.media.altText: The user invokes @workspace in the Chat panel in the secondary sidebar to understand the code base. Copilot retrieves the relevant information and provides a response with links to the files
puku.walkthrough.inlineChatNotMac.title: Use natural language in your files
puku.walkthrough.inlineChatNotMac.descri:
Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Ctrl+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.
Inline Chat view in the editor. The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
puku.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.title: Use natural language in your files
puku.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.descripti:
Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Cmd+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.
puku.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.media.alt: The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
puku.walkthrough.edits.title: Make changes using natural language
puku.walkthrough.edits.description:
Use **Copilot Edits** to select files you want to work with and describe changes you want to make. Copilot applies them directly to your files.
[Edit with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22edit%22%7D)
puku.walkthrough.edits.media.altText: The video shows the user dragging and dropping files into the Copilot Edits input box located in the secondary sidebar. Copilot then updates the file according to the userâ€™s request
puku.walkthrough.sparkle.title: Look out for smart actions
puku.walkthrough.sparkle.description:
Copilot enhances your coding experience with AI-powered smart actions throughout the VS Code interface.
Look for $(sparkle) icons, such as in the [Source Control view](command:workbench.view.scm), where Copilot generates commit messages and PR descriptions based on code changes.

[Discover Tips and Tricks](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/copilot-vscode-features)
puku.walkthrough.sparkle.media.altText: The video shows the sparkle icon in the source control input box being clicked, triggering Puku Editor to generate a commit message automatically
puku.chat.completionContext.typescript.m: The execution mode of the TypeScript Copilot context provider.
puku.chat.languageContext.typescript.ena: Enables the TypeScript language context provider for inline suggestions
puku.chat.languageContext.typescript.ite: Controls which kind of items are included in the TypeScript language context provider.
puku.chat.languageContext.typescript.inc: Controls whether to include documentation comments in the generated code snippets.
puku.chat.languageContext.typescript.cac: The cache population timeout for the TypeScript language context provider in milliseconds. The default is 500 milliseconds.
puku.chat.languageContext.fix.typescript: Enables the TypeScript language context provider for /fix commands
puku.chat.languageContext.inline.typescr: Enables the TypeScript language context provider for inline chats (both generate and edit)
puku.config.enableUserPreferences: Enable remembering user preferences in agent mode.

puku.config.newWorkspace.useContext7: Whether to use the [Context7](command:puku.mcp.viewContext7) tools to scaffold project for new workspace creation.
puku.config.editsNewNotebook.enabled: Whether to enable the new notebook tool in Copilot Edits.
puku.config.notebook.inlineEditAgent.ena: Enable agent-like behavior from the notebook inline chat widget.
puku.config.summarizeAgentConversationHi: Whether to auto-summarize agent conversation history once the context window is filled.

puku.config.agent.currentEditorContext.e: When enabled, Copilot will include the name of the current active editor in the context for agent mode.
puku.config.customInstructionsInSystemMe: When enabled, custom instructions and mode instructions will be appended to the system message instead of a user message.
copilot.toolSet.search.description: Search and read files in your workspace
copilot.toolSet.new.description: Scaffold a new workspace with VS Code-specific configurations to compile, debug and run new projects.
puku.config.useResponsesApi:
Use the Responses API instead of the Chat Completions API when supported. Enables reasoning and reasoning summaries.

**Note**: This is an experimental feature that is not yet activated for all users.

**Important**: URL API path resolution for custom OpenAI-compatible and Azure models is independent of this setting and fully determined by `url` property of `#puku.chat.customOAIModels#` or `#puku.chat.azureModels#` respectively.
puku.config.responsesApiReasoningEffort: Sets the reasoning effort used for the Responses API. Requires `#puku.chat.useResponsesApi#`.
puku.config.responsesApiReasoningSummary: Sets the reasoning summary style used for the Responses API. Requires `#puku.chat.useResponsesApi#`.
puku.config.anthropic.thinking.enabled:
Enable extended thinking for Anthropic models that support it. 

 **Note**: This is an experimental feature only supported in BYOK Anthropic models.
puku.config.anthropic.thinking.maxTokens:
Maximum number of tokens to allocate for extended thinking in Anthropic models. Valid range is 1,024 to 32,000 tokens. Always capped at (max output tokens - 1).

**Note**: This is an experimental feature only supported in BYOK Anthropic models.
puku.config.anthropic.tools.websearch.en:
Enable Anthropic's native web search tool for BYOK Claude models. When enabled, allows Claude to search the web for current information. 

**Note**: This is an experimental feature only available for BYOK Anthropic Claude models.
puku.config.anthropic.tools.websearch.ma: Maximum number of web searches allowed per request. Valid range is 1 to 20. Prevents excessive API calls within a single interaction. If Claude exceeds this limit, the response returns an error.
puku.config.anthropic.tools.websearch.al: List of domains to restrict web search results to (e.g., `["example.com", "docs.example.com"]`). Domains should not include the HTTP/HTTPS scheme. Subdomains are automatically included. Cannot be used together with blocked domains.
puku.config.anthropic.tools.websearch.bl: List of domains to exclude from web search results (e.g., `["untrustedsource.com"]`). Domains should not include the HTTP/HTTPS scheme. Subdomains are automatically excluded. Cannot be used together with allowed domains.
puku.config.anthropic.tools.websearch.us: User location for personalizing web search results based on geographic context. All fields (city, region, country, timezone) are optional. Example: `{"city": "San Francisco", "region": "California", "country": "US", "timezone": "America/Los_Angeles"}`
puku.config.tools.memory.enabled:
Enable memory tool to allow models to store and retrieve information across conversations. 

**Note**: This is an experimental feature.
puku.config.completionsFetcher: Sets the fetcher used for the inline completions.
puku.config.nesFetcher: Sets the fetcher used for the next edit suggestions.
puku.config.debug.overrideChatEngine:
Override the chat model. This allows you to test with different models.

**Note**: This is an advanced debugging setting and should not be used while self-hosting as it may lead to a different experience compared to end-users.
puku.config.projectLabels.expanded: Use the expanded format for project labels in prompts.
puku.config.projectLabels.chat: Add project labels in chat requests.
puku.config.projectLabels.inline: Add project labels in inline edit requests.
puku.config.workspace.maxLocalIndexSize: Maximum size of the local workspace index.
puku.config.workspace.enableCodeSearch: Enable code search in workspace context.
puku.config.workspace.enableEmbeddingsSe: Enable embeddings-based search in workspace context.
puku.config.workspace.preferredEmbedding: Preferred embeddings model for semantic search.
puku.config.workspace.prototypeAdoCodeSe: Override endpoint for Azure DevOps code search prototype.
puku.config.feedback.onChange: Enable feedback collection on configuration changes.
puku.config.review.intent: Enable intent detection for code review.
puku.config.notebook.variableFilteringEn: Enable filtering variables by cell document symbols.
puku.config.notebook.alternativeNESForma: Enable alternative format for Next Edit Suggestions in notebooks.
puku.config.editSourceTracking.showDecor: Show decorations for edit source tracking.
puku.config.editSourceTracking.showStatu: Show status bar item for edit source tracking.
puku.config.localWorkspaceRecording.enab: Enable local workspace recording for analysis.
puku.config.temporalContext.maxAge: Maximum age (in editor changes) for temporal context.
puku.config.temporalContext.preferSameLa: Prefer same language files in temporal context.
puku.config.codesearch.agent.enabled: Enable code search capabilities in agent mode.
puku.config.agent.temperature: Temperature setting for agent mode requests.
puku.config.instantApply.shortContextMod: Model name for short context instant apply.
puku.config.instantApply.shortContextLim: Token limit for short context instant apply.
puku.config.summarizeAgentConversationHi: Threshold for summarizing agent conversation history.
puku.config.agentHistorySummarizationWit: Use prompt caching for agent history summarization.
puku.config.agentHistorySummarizationFor: Force GPT-4.1 for agent history summarization.
puku.config.enableReadFileV2: Enable version 2 of the read file tool.
puku.config.enableAskAgent: Enable the Ask agent for answering questions.
puku.config.omitBaseAgentInstructions: Omit base agent instructions from prompts.
puku.config.virtualTools.embeddingRankin: Use embedding-based ranking for virtual tools.
puku.config.claudeCode.debug: Enable debug mode for Claude Code agent.
puku.config.cli.isolation.enabled: Enable CLI isolation for agent sessions.
puku.config.cli.mcp.enabled: Enable Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for CLI.
puku.config.inlineEdits.triggerOnEditorC: Trigger inline edits after editor has been idle for this many seconds.
puku.config.inlineEdits.nextCursorPredic: Display predicted cursor line for next edit suggestions.
Maximum tokens for current file in next cursor prediction.
